generalComment: The experiment was interesting though I wish I had more than 8 rounds of each set of trials in order to more precisely discern the radiation properties at hand.
initial_strategy: During my initial choices, I aimed to find out what in the initial scene was causing the radiation (e.g. the presence of a certain type of cone color and if adding or removing certain cones could influence that outcome).
final_strategy: During my second round of trials, I wanted to refine the rules that I initially laid out and to see what exceptions, if any, could be made. For example, if the presence of one cone was necessary, what happens if I add another that touches it? Does the size or orientation have any affect on the rule?

generalComment: It was harder than I thought it would be!
initial_strategy: I started by trying to mimic the first scene with just one thing different about it and would see if that emitted radiation. If it did I would then change one more thing and continue on. When it didn't emit radiation I would then try to figure out what was different from the others.
final_strategy: The final choices part I just tried to recreate what I thought was the rule in different ways than before. Inevitably I realized I had the rule wrong and would have to fine tune it.

initial_strategy: I tried to start simple & only get more creative when needed.
